result.execSummary:
The defendant Tou Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  AODA and follow through with recommendations.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tou Yang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:39 am 
INCLUDES 14CF1047 AND 14CF971. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty James Kurszewski. 
State notes parties have reached an agreement re: sentencing. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF1047: Ct. 1>>SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITION: 6 months MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations and only to be used with Court approval; $80 of buy money. 
In 14CF971: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on both>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through with recommendations; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit in 14CF1047 and 2 days jail credit in 14CF971 if revoked. 
COURT allows parties to retain their copies of the PSI and directs them to maintain their confidentiality. 
Adj: 8:48 am
Copy of PSI sent to ADA Mayo and Attorney James Kurszewski

Emailed copy to DA's office
sent copy to Defense atty
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

PLEA: 
In 14CF971: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty.

Bond Continues. 
Sentencing set for 1/9/2017 at 8:30 am in Br. 3.
